intro: Miconia nordestina, commonly known as the northeastern miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the Melastomataceae family. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of eastern Brazil, where it thrives in humid, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces fleshy, berry-like fruits that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
